merge_request_diff_commits.message: Reworked getConnection to accommodate different attributes
Reworked getConnection to accommodate different attributes
Fix /api/user servlet so it uses the Authorization header

Made a method to get all unlocked locations of a given team.
To call it, use LocationAttributes.getUnlockedLocationsByTeam
Made environment variable for db login credentials
LocationAttributes is done and also documented
THe final documentation of teams, unless there are missing methods.
Deleting teams can now be done safely :)
user one should work, login should work, tests are not ajusted, all teams is not functional yet
Wrote a simple test for the PersonAttributes class
You can delete and insert persons now in the database
You can leave teams and delete person now :D
Added dynamic querying and also PersonAttributes.getPersonByID
PersonAttributes.getParticipantByTeam works now too and tested

Merge branch 'servlets' into JDBC_connection

# Conflicts:
#	src/main/java/nl/utwente/di/interactief2/JDBC/attributeQueries/TeamAttributes.java
#	target/interactief2.war
#	target/interactief2/META-INF/MANIFEST.MF
AllTeams now returns all teams when asked, the only problem is that the database side does not work for it yet
The user information should now be gettable, a unit test is written for it, formatting of the JSON returned is the only untested thing
Made queries to query all the unlocked locations in LocationAttributes

Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/JDBC_connection' into JDBC_connection

# Conflicts:
#	.idea/sonarlint/issuestore/index.pb
Made queries to query all the unlocked locations in LocationAttributes

Navigation

+Starting from the Overview page, you can browse the documentation using the links in each page, and in the navigation bar at the top of each page. The Index and Search box allow you to navigate to specific declarations and summary pages, including: All Packages, All Classes and Interfaces +
+

Search

+

You can search for definitions of modules, packages, types, fields, methods, system properties and other terms defined in the API, using some or all of the name, optionally using "camelCase" abbreviations. For example:

+
    +
  • j.l.obj will match "java.lang.Object"
    • +
  • InpStr will match "java.io.InputStream"
    • +
  • HM.cK will match "java.util.HashMap.containsKey(Object)"
    • +
+

Refer to the Javadoc Search Specification for a full description of search features.

+
+
+
+
+

Kinds of Pages

+The following sections describe the different kinds of pages in this collection. +
+

Package

+

Each package has a page that contains a list of its classes and interfaces, with a summary for each. These pages may contain the following categories:

+
    +
  • Interfaces
    • +
  • Classes
    • +
  • Enum Classes
    • +
  • Exceptions
    • +
  • Errors
    • +
  • Annotation Interfaces
    • +
+
+
+

Class or Interface

+

Each class, interface, nested class and nested interface has its own separate page. Each of these pages has three sections consisting of a declaration and description, member summary tables, and detailed member descriptions. Entries in each of these sections are omitted if they are empty or not applicable.

+
    +
  • Class Inheritance Diagram
    • +
  • Direct Subclasses
    • +
  • All Known Subinterfaces
    • +
  • All Known Implementing Classes
    • +
  • Class or Interface Declaration
    • +
  • Class or Interface Description
    • +
+
+
    +
  • Nested Class Summary
    • +
  • Enum Constant Summary
    • +
  • Field Summary
    • +
  • Property Summary
    • +
  • Constructor Summary
    • +
  • Method Summary
    • +
  • Required Element Summary
    • +
  • Optional Element Summary
    • +
+
+
    +
  • Enum Constant Details
    • +
  • Field Details
    • +
  • Property Details
    • +
  • Constructor Details
    • +
  • Method Details
    • +
  • Element Details
    • +
+

Note: Annotation interfaces have required and optional elements, but not methods. Only enum classes have enum constants. The components of a record class are displayed as part of the declaration of the record class. Properties are a feature of JavaFX.

+

The summary entries are alphabetical, while the detailed descriptions are in the order they appear in the source code. This preserves the logical groupings established by the programmer.

+
+
+

Other Files

+

Packages and modules may contain pages with additional information related to the declarations nearby.

+
+
+

Tree (Class Hierarchy)

+

There is a Class Hierarchy page for all packages, plus a hierarchy for each package. Each hierarchy page contains a list of classes and a list of interfaces. Classes are organized by inheritance structure starting with java.lang.Object. Interfaces do not inherit from java.lang.Object.

+
    +
  • When viewing the Overview page, clicking on TREE displays the hierarchy for all packages.
    • +
  • When viewing a particular package, class or interface page, clicking on TREE displays the hierarchy for only that package.
    • +
+
+
+

Constant Field Values

+

The Constant Field Values page lists the static final fields and their values.

+
+
+

All Packages

+

The All Packages page contains an alphabetic index of all packages contained in the documentation.

+
+
+

All Classes and Interfaces

+

The All Classes and Interfaces page contains an alphabetic index of all classes and interfaces contained in the documentation, including annotation interfaces, enum classes, and record classes.

+
+
+

Index

+

The Index contains an alphabetic index of all classes, interfaces, constructors, methods, and fields in the documentation, as well as summary pages such as All Packages, All Classes and Interfaces.

+
+
+
+This help file applies to API documentation generated by the standard doclet.
+
+
+ +

title: Change Authentication(Filter) to LoggedIn(Filter), added Participant(Filter) and Admin(Filter) annotations
description:
There are 3 filters
* LoggedIn: you need to be logged in but it does not matter whether you are an admin, participant or just a person
* Admin: you need to be logged in and an admin
* Participant: you need to be logged in and a participant
